summary: This document is a set of daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York for August 7, 2019. It details routine operational activities, inmate counts, movements, and administrative actions across three shifts (Morning, Day, and Evening Watch). The logs show the facility's population and operational status on the day Jeffrey Epstein died in custody, though his name is not explicitly mentioned in these entries.

events.title: MCC NYC Daily Operations
events.description: Routine daily operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, including multiple inmate counts, inmate movements (transfers, releases, new commitments), equipment checks, and administrative detentions.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
USP Canaan (referenced as origin for an inmate transfer)
keyFacts: This log documents the operational status of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York on August 7, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein died in custody.
The log shows routine activities: multiple inmate counts, inmate movements (transfers, releases, new commitments), and system checks (fire alarms, body alarms, metal detectors).
Several inmates (Almanzar, Benjamin, Ramos) are noted as 'pending bed space' in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and later placed in '2nd floor observation quarters' with inmate companions.
Multiple inmates were placed in Administrative Detention, including Rene and Desilva for a pending SIS investigation, and Rodriguez for a 'Cims concern'.
The fire alarm and public address systems were reported as malfunctioning or inoperable during the Day and Evening Watch shifts, impacting the ability to conduct PREA announcements.
